A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I'm a Star Wars fan so any movie in this franchise is going to get 3 stars... even movies with CGI amphibians.  The Last Jedi gets a solid 4/5.

The ending of this movie is great and exactly what I hoped for.  A resolution to the stories of the remaining originals: Luke\, Leia\, Chewbacca.  The problem is that the film also needs to advance the story of the next generation: Rey\, Kylo\, Poe\, and Finn.  And\, it also throws in another one: Rose.  This confuses the movie in my mind and makes it harder to follow.

I did appreciate a lot of the parallels with The Empire Strikes Back.  Questions of parentage answered (sort of?).  Jedi Training in a desolate place.  Massive battle on a white planet (salt... not ice) with an updated AT-AT assault.  These throwbacks were cool at first blush but\, upon further review\, seem to show a lack of creativity and formulaic.

This installment of the trilogy does little to advance the story; it just ties up or eliminates a lot of loose ends that were hanging around after mixing the stories in Ep. 7.  A tighter story more centralized on the new generation would have been better.
